title: Resolution of the Linear-Bounded Automata Question
abstract:
This work resolves a longstanding open question in automata theory, i.e., the {\em linear-bounded automata question} ({\em LBA question}), which can also be phrased succinctly in the language of computational complexity theory as $DSPACE[n]\overset{?}{=} NSPACE[n]$. We show first that $DSPACE[n]
eq NSPACE[n]$. Then, we show by padding argument that $DSPACE[\log n]
eq NSPACE[\log n]$. Our proof technique is primarily based on diagonalization by a universal nondeterministic $n$ space-bounded Turing machine against all deterministic $n$ space-bounded Turing machines. Our proof also implies the following fundamental consequences:   (1) There is no deterministic Turing machine of space complexity $\log n$ deciding the $st$-connectivity question (STCON);   (2) $L
eq P$.
